snippet: A report that the homeless population of Los Angeles County rose 12 percent in two years has set off a wave of concern and raised questions about gentrification.
abstract: Report released by Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority in May that found number of city's homeless jumped 12 percent in 2 years has raised concerns about widespread gentrification in LA; report puts number of homeless in Los Angeles County at 44,359, and many point to area's high housing costs and relative lack of inexpensive rentals as source of problem.
lead_paragraph: A report that the homeless population of Los Angeles County rose 12 percent in two years has set off a wave of concern and raised questions about gentrification.

headline.main: Los Angeles Confronts a Spike in Homelessness Amid Prosperity
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Confronts a Spike in Homelessness
